text: Mats Traat (23 November 1936 – 27 June 2022) was an Estonian poet, translator and novelist. Traat was born in Arula, Otepää Parish. His career began in 1962. He published over 20 anthologies of poetry. His poetry was about social commentary and society's love for science. He also wrote about the indigenous Estonian population. His short story, The Cross of Power, won the Friedebert Tuglas Award for Short Prose. Traat died on 27 June 2022 in Tallinn, Estonia at the age of 85.Suri kirjanik Mats Traat ==References== ==Other websites== * Estonian Literature Information Center Category:1936 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Estonian writers Category:Estonian poets Category:European novelists Category:Estonian translators
title: Mats Traat
